arm_group.description: patients undergoing general anesthesia for any surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
Failure of advanced airway security has been reported that it could lead lethal complication
      such as brain hypoxic damage. There have been controversial reports for the airway
      assessment tests which can predict difficult laryngoscopy. Therefore, we evaluated
      diagnostic validity of pre-existing airway assessment tests and scoring system using a gray
      zone approach in patients undergoing general anesthesia required endotracheal intubation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Clinical Airway Assessments With a Gray Zone Approach

detailed_description.textblock:
POGO(percentage of glottic opening)will be evaluated by an attachable fiberoptic scope (AV
      scope. CAREtec CO.Ltd, Kangwon-Do, South Korea)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  20 to 80 years old patients undergoing general anesthesia for any operation.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous difficult airway history

          -  upper airway obstruction disease

          -  congenital disorders that are known to relate with difficult airway

          -  neurologic symptom associated with neck extension

          -  emergent operation

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing general anesthesia for any surgery at Samsung medical center

intervention.intervention_name: Measurements of parameters related with physical examinations for difficult airway prediction

clinical_study.keyword: Physical examinations, Percentage of glottic opening(POGO)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Clinical Airway Assessments for Predicting Difficult Laryngoscopy Using a Gray Zone Approach

primary_outcome.description: POGO image will be captured using attachable fiberoptic scope.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During laryngoscopy manipulation for endotracheal intubation (average 3min after muscle relaxant is delivered)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
